title: Inside Soap Awards 2019: Coronation Street's Katie McGlynn puts on busty display on the red carpet
text:
Advertisement

Her character Sinead Tinker is set to make a heartbreaking exit as she loses her battle with cancer.

And ahead of her onscreen Coronation Street departure, Katie McGlynn put on an eye-popping display as she walked the red carpet for the 2019 Inside Soap Awards at London venue Sway on Monday.

The actress, 26, turned heads in a plunging white caped dress as she joined her fellow soap stars, including a very glamorous Louisa Lytton, at the swanky event.

Wow: Katie McGlynn put on an eye-popping display as she walked the red carpet for the 2019 Inside Soap Awards at London venue Sway on Monday

The cleavage-baring number featured cute pockets and a belt that clinched in her waist.

She teamed her ensemble with a black clutch bag and boosted her height with a pair of strappy sandals.

Katie swept her blonde tresses into an elegant up 'do, while she added an element of vampish glam with dark red lips and smokey eyes.

The star's appearance comes as her character Sinead is soon to lose her cancer fight, leaving behind husband Daniel and son Bertie.

Eye-catching: The actress, 26, turned heads in a plunging white caped dress as she joined her fellow soap stars at the swanky event

Gorgeous: The cleavage-baring number featured cute pockets and a belt that clinched in her waist

Sizzling: All eyes were on Katie as she put on a sensational display on the red carpet

Last month Katie marked the end of her time on the ITV soap on Instagram , writing a poignant message where she encouraged women to go to smear tests, alongside a picture of herself and her on-screen husband Daniel Osbourne (Rob Mallard).

Katie penned: 'After nearly 7 wonderful years playing Sinead Tinker, my time on the cobbles is coming to an end.

'I feel so privileged & honoured to have been a part of @coronationstreet I’ve honestly enjoyed every single second working alongside a BRILLIANT cast and crew who go above and beyond to make Corrie the amazing show that it is.

Stunning: Katie swept her blonde tresses into an elegant up 'do, while she added an element of vampish glam with dark red lips and smokey eyes

Almost time: The star's appearance comes as her character Sinead is soon to lose her cancer fight, leaving behind husband Daniel and son Bertie

'I’m going to miss everyone so much. I’m sad to be leaving Sinead behind, but I felt the time was right for me to spread my wings & pursue other opportunities.

'As a team we felt Sinead’s ending on the show should highlight the importance of cervical cancer screenings - and that women NEED to go for their smear tests.

'Also, to highlight the issues women face when affected by cancer in or around pregnancy @mummys.star.

Showstopping: Representing EastEnders on the night was Louisa Lytton, 30, who looked stunning in a baby blue mini dress

Into the blue: The star, who plays Ruby Allen on the BBC soap, looked happy and confident as she posed in her structured blue number which showcased her shapely pins to perfection

Delightful: The beauty styled her brunette tresses into bouncy curls swept over one shoulder, while her face had a layer of glam make-up

'Everyone has been working so hard on this storyline and I just hope I do Sinead, the show and the thousands of women out their who have been in Sinead’s position, justice.

'Sinead Tinker might be leaving Coronation Street, but I’ll carry a piece of her quirkinesses with me forever #Corrie #SineadTinker #CancerandPregnancy #CervicalCancer.'

Representing EastEnders on the night was Louisa Lytton, 30, who looked stunning in a baby blue mini dress.

All that glitters: Her EastEnders co-star Maisie Smith meanwhile upped the glam in a silver, backless cowl neck top and shimmering silver-grey trousers

Glitz and glam: The Tiffany Butcher star teamed her dazzling ensemble with dark grey heels and a matching clutch bag

Bronzed: The soap favourite styled her flame tresses into a sleek, poker straight 'do, while she applied a generous layer of tan to her skin

Co-stars: While on the carpet, she also took the opportunity to pose with co-star Zack Morris, who plays her onscreen boyfriend Keegan Taylor

The star, who plays Ruby Allen on the BBC soap, looked happy and confident as she posed in her structured blue number which showcased her shapely pins to perfection.

She accessorised her look with a beaded pink handbag and shimmering earrings, and added height to her petite frame with brown, pointed heels.

The beauty styled her brunette tresses into bouncy curls swept over one shoulder, while her face had a layer of glam make-up.

Her EastEnders co-star Maisie Smith meanwhile upped the glam in a silver, backless cowl neck top and shimmering silver-grey trousers.

The Tiffany Butcher star teamed her dazzling ensemble with dark grey heels and a matching clutch bag.

The soap favourite styled her flame tresses into a sleek, poker straight 'do, while she applied a generous layer of tan to her skin.

While on the carpet, she also took the opportunity to pose with co-star Zack Morris, who plays her onscreen boyfriend Keegan Taylor.

Beautiful: Meanwhile, Katie's former Coronation Street co-star Bhanva Limbachia was also in attendance, looking gorgeous in a black mini dress with ruffled and lace detailing

Gracious in defeat: The actress, 35, flashed a warm smile despite losing out in the best exit category following the heartbreaking onscreen death of her character Rana Habeeb

Leading ladies: Bhavna and Katie posed alongside fellow Corrie babe Cassie Bradley (Natalie Watkins) on the red carpet

Meanwhile, Katie's former Coronation Street co-star Bhanva Limbachia was also in attendance, looking gorgeous in a black mini dress with ruffled and lace detailing.

The actress, 35, flashed a warm smile despite losing out in the best exit category following the heartbreaking onscreen death of her character Rana Habeeb.

Monday night saw the annual Inside Soap Awards return with the big-hitters in soapland battling it out for the coveted trophies.

But it was Hollyoaks that came out on top as they won the biggest prize on the night of best soap - the first time the Channel 4 show has won the award in the event's history.

And the triumph didn't stop there for the Chester-based programme as stars Stephanie Davis and Adam Woodward also bagged the best actor and actress gongs.

Historic win: Hollyoaks that came out on top as they won the biggest prize on the night of best soap - the first time the Channel 4 show has won the award in the event's history

It was a well deserved victory for the soap, which began in 1995, after such a momentous year.

Huge storylines that have kept viewers gripped over the past year include Breda McQueen being revealed as a serial killer, Ste Hay's far-right movement plot and Maxine Minniver lying about her illness.

Meanwhile, since making her return to the show in 2018, Stephanie Davis went from strength-to-strength with her powerful portrayal of Sinead Shelby and her horrific rape ordeal at the hands of evil late husband Laurie.

While Adam Woodward had often left fans in tears amid his abuse storyline that eventually saw his character Brody Hudson stand up and speak out against his abuser Buster Smith.

Victory: It was a triumphant night for Hollyaoks' Stephanie Davis as she won the best actress prize for playing Sinead Shelby

Well deserved: Adam Woodward bagged the best actor gong for his role as Brody Husdon in Hollyoaks

Elsewhere, other big winners on the night included EastEnders favourites Danny Dyer (Mick Carter) and Lorraine Stanley (Karen Taylor), who both scooped the funniest male and funniest female goings respectively.

There were further prizes for the Walford lot as the talented Kara-Leah Fernandes won the best young actor award.

While Max Bowden - who is the sixth actor to portray Ben Mitchell - quite deservedly scooped the best bad boy prize.

Louise Clein won the best bad girl gong form her role as Emmerdale paedophile Maya Stepney, with her character causing so much outrage that viewers had often switched off while she was onscreen!

You're having a laugh: EastEnders favourite Danny Dyer aka Mick Carter won funniest male

Comedy Queen: Lorraine Stanley scooped funniest female for playing Karen Taylor

Other big winners on the night included Coronation Street's Maureen Lipman who won best newcomer, while Lisa Dingle's heartbreaking death in Emmerdale earned actress Jane Cox the best exit prize.

While the gripping plots of Carla's mental health (Coronation Street) and the big night out (Emmerdale) won the best show-stopper and best shock twist prizes respectfully.

In a statement as the winners were announced, Inside Soap editor Steven Murphy said: 'It’s been an amazing soap year – in fact, the awards have never been more keenly fought.

'Looking down the winners list, the UK should be extremely proud of our soaps and our soap stars, as the breadth of talent among the winners is astonishing.'
description: Ahead of her onscreen Coronation Street departure, Katie McGlynn put on an eye-popping display at the 2019 Inside Soap Awards at London venue Sway on Monday.
